Animals

Elephant

/ˈɛlɪfənt/

A very large plant-eating mammal with a long, flexible trunk, large ears, tusks, and four thick legs.

Fun Facts

  • Elephants are the largest land animals on Earth!
  • An elephant's trunk has more than 40,000 muscles.
  • Elephants can live for 60-70 years.
  • Baby elephants are called calves.
